question: A lower airspeed at constant mass and altitude requires:

choices.choice: less thrust and a lower coefficient of lift
more thrust and a lower coefficient of lift
more thrust and a lower coefficient of drag
a higher coefficient of lift

subject: Performance

question: The maximum horizontal speed occurs when:

choices.choice: The thrust is equal to minimum drag
The thrust does not increase further with increasing speed
The maximum thrust is equal to the total drag
The thrust is equal to the maximum drag

subject: Performance

question: Under which condition should you fly considerably lower (4,000 ft or more) than the optimum altitude?

choices.choice: If at the lower altitude either more headwind or less tailwind can be expected
If at the lower altitude either considerably less headwind or considerably more tailwind can be expected
If the maximum altitude is below the optimum altitude
If the temperature is lower at the low altitude (high altitude inversion.

subject: Performance

question: Maximum endurance:

choices.choice: is the same as maximum specific range with wind correction
can be flown in a steady climb only
can be reached with the 'best rate of climb' speed in level flight
is achieved in unaccelerated level flight with minimum fuel consumption

subject: Performance

question: The optimum altitude:

choices.choice: is the altitude up to which cabin pressure of 8 000 ft can be maintained
increases as mass decreases and is the altitude at which the specific range reaches its maximum
decreases as mass decreases
is the altitude at which the specific range reaches its minimum

subject: Performance

question: If the thrust available exceeds the thrust required for level flight:

choices.choice: the aeroplane accelerates if the altitude is maintained
the aeroplane descends if the airspeed is maintained
the aeroplane decelerates if it is in the region of reversed command
the aeroplane decelerates if the altitude is maintained

subject: Performance

question: The optimum cruise altitude is:

choices.choice: the pressure altitude up to which a cabin altitude of 8,000 ft can be maintained
the pressure altitude at which the TAS for high speed buffet is a maximum
the pressure altitude at which the best specific range can be achieved
the pressure altitude at which the fuel flow is a maximum

subject: Performance

question: Maximum endurance for a prison engined aeroplane is achieved at:

choices.choice: The speed that approximately corresponds to the maximum rate of climb speed
The speed for maximum lift coefficient
The speed for minimum drag
The speed that corresponds to the speed for maximum climb angle

subject: Performance

question: On a long distance flight the gross mass decreases continuously as a consequence of the fuel consumption. The result is:

choices.choice: The speed must be increased to compensate the lower mass
The specific range increases and the optimum altitude decreases
The specific range decreases and the optimum altitude increases
The specific range and the optimum altitude increases

subject: Performance

question: The pilot of a light twin engine aircraft has calculated a 4,000 m service ceiling with a take-off mass 3,250 kg, based on the general forecast conditions for the flight. If the take-off mass is 3,000 kg the service ceiling will be:

choices.choice: less than 4,000 m
unchanged, equal to 4,000 m
only a new performance analysis will determine if the service ceiling is higher or lower than 4,000 m
higher than 4,000 m

subject: Performance

question: What is the effect of a head wind component, compared to still air, on the maximum range speed for maximum climb angle respectively?

choices.choice: Maximum range speed decreases and maximum climb angle speed decreases
Maximum range speed increases and maximum climb angle speed increases
Maximum range speed increases and maximum climb angle speed stays constant
maximum range speed decreases and maximum climb angle speed increases

subject: Performance

question: For a piston engined aeroplane, the speed for maximum range is:

choices.choice: that which gives the maximum lift to drag ratio
that which gives the minimum value of power
that which gives the maximum value of lift
1.4 times the stall speed in clean configuration

subject: Performance

question: The speed for maximum endurance:

choices.choice: is always higher than the speed for maximum specific range
is always lower than the speed for maximum specific range
is the lower speed to achieve 99% of maximum specific range
can either be higher or lower than the speed for maximum specific range

subject: Performance

question: A jet aeroplane is performing a maximum range flight. The speed corresponds to:

choices.choice: the minimum drag
the minimum required power
the point of contact of the tangent from the origin to the power required (Pr. versus TAS curve
the point of contact of the tangent from the origin to the Drag versus TAS curve

subject: Performance

question: The lowest point of the frag or thrust required curve of a jet aeroplane, is the point for:

choices.choice: minimum drag and maximum endurance
maximum specific range and minimum power
minimum power
minimum specific range

subject: Performance

question: A jet aeroplane is flying at the long range cruise speed at the optimum altitude. How does the specific range / fuel flow change over a given time period?

choices.choice: Decrease / decrease
Increase / decrease
Increase / increase
Decrease / increase

subject: Performance

question: Which of the following sequences of speed for a jet aeroplane is correct? (from low to high speeds.

choices.choice: Maximum endurance speed, maximum range speed, maximum angle of climb speed
Maximum endurance speed, long range speed, maximum range speed
Vs, maximum angle climb speed, maximum range speed
Vs, maximum range speed, maximum angle climb speed

subject: Performance

question: The optimum long-range cruise altitude for a turbo-jet aeroplane:

choices.choice: is only dependent on the outside air temperature
increases when the aeroplane mass decreases
is always equal to the powerplant ceiling
is independent of the aeroplane mass

subject: Performance

question: The centre of gravity moving near to, but still within, the aft limit;

choices.choice: increases the stalling speed
improves the longitudinal stability
decreases the maximum range
improves the maximum range

subject: Performance

question: Consider the graphic representation of the power required for a jet aeroplane versus true air speed (TAS). When drawing the tangent out of the origin, the point of contact determines the speed of:

choices.choice: critical angle of attack
maximum endurance
minimum power
maximum specific range

subject: Performance

question: The speed VS is defined as the:

choices.choice: speed for best specific range
stalling speed or minimum steady flight speed at which the aeroplane is controllable
safety speed for take-off in case of a contaminated runway
design stress speed

subject: Performance

question: The maximum indicated air speed of a piston engined aeroplane, in level flight, is reached:

choices.choice: at the service ceiling
at the practical ceiling
at the lowest possible altitude
at the optimum cruise altitude

subject: Performance

question: Why are ‘step climbs’ used on long distance flights?

choices.choice: Step climbs do not have any special purpose for jet aeroplanes; they are used for piston engine aeroplanes only
ATC do not permit cruise climbs
To fly as close as possible to the optimum altitude as aeroplane mass reduces
Step climbs are only justified if at the higher altitude less headwind or more tailwind can be expected

subject: Performance

question: Long range cruise is a flight procedure which gives:

choices.choice: an IAS which is 1% higher than the IAS for maximum specific range
a specific range which is 99% of maximum specific range and a lower cruise speed
a specific range which is about 99% of maximum specific range and higher cruise speed
a 1% higher TAS for maximum specific range

subject: Performance

question: In the drag versus speed curve for a jet aeroplane, the speed for maximum range corresponds with:

choices.choice: the point of contact of the tangent from the origin to the drag curve
the point of intersection of the parasite drag curve and the induced drag curve
the point of contact of the tangent from the origin to the parasite drag curve
the point of contact of the tangent from the origin to the induced drag curve

subject: Performance

question: The pilot of a jet aeroplane wants to use a minimum amount of fuel between two airfields. Which flight procedure should the pilot fly?

choices.choice: Maximum endurance
Holding
Long range
Maximum range

subject: Performance

question: Which of the following is a reason to operate an aeroplane at ‘long range speed’?

choices.choice: The aircraft can be operated close to the buffet onset speed
In order to prevent loss of speed stability and tuck-under
It offers greatly reduced time costs than with maximum range speed
In order to achieve speed stability

subject: Performance

question: Moving the centre of gravity from the forward to the aft limit: (gross mass, altitude and airspeed remain unchanged)

choices.choice: increases the power required
affects neither drag nor power required
increases the induced drag
decreases slightly because of the lower air density

subject: Performance

question: For a jet transport aeroplane,which of the following is the reason for the use of ‘maximum range speed’?

choices.choice: Minimises specific fuel consumption
Minimises fuel flow
Longest flight duration
Minimises drag

subject: Performance

question: Given a jet aircraft. Which order of speeds is correct?

choices.choice: Vs, Maximum range speed, Vx
Maximum endurance speed, Maximum range speed, VX
Vs, Vx Maximum range speed
Maximum endurance speed, Long range speed, Maximum range speed

subject: Performance

question: The optimum cruise altitude increases:

choices.choice: if the aeroplane mass is decreased
if the temperature (OAT) is increased
if the tailwind component is decreased
if the aeroplane mass is increased

subject: Performance

question: The point at which a tangent out of the origin touches the power required curve:

choices.choice: is the point where Drag coefficient is a minimum
is the point where the Lift of Drag ratio is a minimum
is the maximum drag speed
is the point where the Lift to Drag ratio is a maximum

subject: Performance

question: During a cruise flight of a jet aeroplane at a constant flight level and at the maximum range speed, the IAS / the drag will:

choices.choice: increase / increase
decrease / increase
decrease / decrease
increase / decrease

subject: Performance

question: If other factors are unchanged, the fuel mileage or range (nautical miles per kg. is :

choices.choice: independent from the centre of gravity position
lower with an aft centre of gravity position
higher with a forward centre of gravity position
lower with a forward centre of gravity position

subject: Performance

question: When utilising the step climb technique, one should wait for the weight reduction, from fuel burn, to result in:

choices.choice: The aerodynamic ceiling to increase by approximately 2,000ft above the present altitude whereby one would climb approximately 4,000ft higher
The optimum altitude to increase by approximately 2,000ft above the present altitude, whereby one would climb approximately 4,000ft higher
The manoeuvre ceiling to increase by approximately 2,000ft above the present altitude, whereby one would climb approximately 4,000ft higher
The en-route ceiling to increase by approximately 2,000ft above the present altitude, whereby one would climb approximately 4,000ft higher

subject: Performance

question: For jet-engined aeroplanes operating below the optimum altitude, what is the effect of increased altitude on specific range?

choices.choice: It does not change
Increases only if there is no wind
Increases
Decreases

subject: Performance

question: The long range cruise speed (LRC) is in relation to the speed for maximum range cruise (MRC)?

choices.choice: Lower
Depending on the OAT and net mass
Depending on density altitude and mass
Higher

subject: Performance

question: Which of the following statements is true regarding the performance of an aeroplane in level flight?

choices.choice: The maximum level flight speed will be obtained when the power required equals the maximum power available from the engine
The minimum level flight speed will be obtained when the power required equals the maximum power available from the engine
The maximum level flight speed will be obtained when the power required equals the minimum power available from the engine
The maximum level flight speed will be obtained when the power required equals the power available from the engine

subject: Performance

question: On a reciprocating engined aeroplane, with increasing altitude at constant gross mass, constant angle of attack and configuration, the power required:

choices.choice: remains unchanged but the TAS increases
increases and the TAS increases by the same percentage
increases but TAS remains constant
decreases slightly because of the lower air density

subject: Performance

question: Which of the equations below defines specific air range (SR)?

choices.choice: SR=Groundspeed / Total Fuel Flow
SR=True Airspeed / Total Fuel Flow
SR=Indicated Airspeed / Total Fuel Flow
SR=Mach Number / Total Fuel Flow

subject: Performance

question: Which of the following statements, with regard to the optimum altitude (best fuel mileage), is correct?

choices.choice: An aeroplane usually flies above the optimum cruise altitude, as this provides the largest specific range
An aeroplane sometimes flies above the optimum cruise altitude, because ATC normally does not allow to fly continuously at the optimum cruise altitude.
An aeroplane always flies below the optimum cruise altitude, as otherwise Mach buffet can occur
An aeroplane always flies on the optimum cruise altitude, because this is most attractive from an economy point of view

subject: Performance

question: What affect has a tailwind on the maximum endurance speed?

choices.choice: No affect
Tailwind only affects holding speed
The IAS will be increased
The IAS will be decreased

subject: Performance

question: A jet aeroplane is climbing at constant Mach number below the tropopause. Which of the following statements is correct?

choices.choice: IAS decreases and TAS decreases
IAS increases and TAS increases
IAS decreases and TAS increases
IAS increases and TAS decreases

subject: Performance

question: To achieve the maximum range over ground with headwind the airspeed should be:

choices.choice: lower compared to the speed for maximum range cruise with no wind
reduced to the gust penetration speed
higher compared to the speed for maximum range cruise with no wind
equal to the speed for maximum range cruise with no wind

subject: Performance

question: Long range cruise is selected as:

choices.choice: the higher speed to achieve 99% of maximum specific range in zero wind
the speed for best economy (ECON)
the climbing cruise with one or two engines inoperative
specific range with tailwind

subject: Performance

question: The intersections of the thrust available and the drag curve are the operating points of the aeroplane:

choices.choice: in un-accelerated climb
in un-accelerated level flight
in descent with constant IAS
in accelerated level flight

subject: Performance
